item.title: Java diggers poll
item.dc:creator: @Krichevskoy Krichevskoy
item.description:
@Krichevskoy wrote:

[quote=“pplsuqbawlz, post:16, topic:55242”]By the way, has anyone else noticed that the cache is now in a new directory?
Or are you still playing footsie with each other.[/quote]

An interesting fact: it was mentioned in public SRL boards over a week ago.
That really says something about the state of communication and client hacking here…

In their defense, it will still use .file_store_32 if it exists - so it’s entirely possible that someone who doesn’t regularly delete uid.dat or corrupt the cache wouldn’t have noticed yet.

Read full topic

item.title: Java diggers poll
item.dc:creator: @pplsuqbawlz pplsuqbawlz
item.description:
@pplsuqbawlz wrote:

Silver Lining:

I’ll soon be able to say that I’ve made my own bot.

Liar liar.[quote=“Javacisnotrecognized, post:12, topic:55242”]I would have made 1 class for each kind of event the OS notifies you about, and include in them fields indicating the specifics. Nothing more. No ‘paint event’, ‘component event’, ‘item event’, ‘generic worthless event’ etc. Stick with the basics. Make maybe one or 2 threads depending on how many ‘seperable’ events there are (Like keyevents vs mouseevents) and left it at that.[/quote]

Dude, no more crack for you.

By the way, has anyone else noticed that the cache is now in a new directory?
Or are you still playing footsie with each other.

Read full topic

item.title: Java diggers poll
item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

I would have made 1 class for each kind of event the OS notifies you about, and include in them fields indicating the specifics. Nothing more. No ‘paint event’, ‘component event’, ‘item event’, ‘generic worthless event’ etc. Stick with the basics. Make maybe one or 2 threads depending on how many ‘seperable’ events there are (Like keyevents vs mouseevents) and left it at that.

Read full topic

item.title: Java diggers poll
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Javacisnotrecognized:

All I understand about it is that anything that tries to render graphics in Java without using a graphics library is doomed. Same for Java’s event model. They have over 300 god damn ints devoted to different kind of events. Whoever was in charge of designing the Java event model is a moron.

Please explain how you would have done it better, then.

Read full topic

currently trying to make a bot, so i will get down n dirty with it some day
